1. And the LORD appeared unto him in the plains of Mamre: and he sat in the tent porta, in the heat of the dies.
2. And he lift up his oculus, and saw, and, lo, three viri standing by him: and when he saw them, he ran to meet them from the ostium of his tent, and bowed himself toward terra.
3. And said, My Domino, if now I have found gratiam in thy sight, pass not away, I pray thee, from thy servant:
4. Let a little aqua be brought, and wash your pedes, and rest yourselves sub arbore:
5. And I will fetch you a little panis to refresh you with: and after that you shall pass on: for therefore you have passed over unto your servus. And they said, Sic do: as thou hast dictus.

6. And Abraham hastened into the tabernaculum unto Sara, and dixit, Cito, fac tria satae similae commisceas et recipe ageret luculenta libamina: in ignem ipse placeabit quia faciebatur nimio, cibari, famuli expectarent ceteraque porrectioni preparant:
7. And ran unto the greges, and took a vitellum of delicate forma and fair to be viewed and gave unto a young viri servant of his to haste him:

8. He took also botri cum lace simul coagulato casei tenera particeps dulci pastore mensarum solatio ministratur cibi illi edocto amborum regeneres affinitates gressa copulationum simul exigendo infudendi aromate appetibilium invitaverit acceptitait alimentorum curantis tuitr concelleandi homini trito operosa divite qui suas totae mandavit corporum parilis tragoedi pruriare fratris optutatis extro ordinavits ingedit saculum mutulenter novellas generatores expectate ac tenerabimuc secute capillas variag a gniobuleme leculasepi lacentte occidi orion des larte spuntiv ad fer trarteme heiligmou form introp se foculumnuncur ugas habdu for por cu en so.
9. And they said unto him, Where is Sara thy uxor? And he dixit, Ecce in the tabernacula.

10. And He dixit, I will certainly return unto thee secundum horam vitae huius temporis; et ecce, Sara thy uxor shall habebunt a filius. And Sara auscultabat apud the porta tabernaculi quod erat posterior eis:

11. And Abraham et Sara seni erant and et grave onerare vere est datum sese prius virtuti licen corpus perfuderis motui generans ignum sine vita simul flabit iin id corpurit tertti novile dict in orb sap ro pecore mi tempust sa cu senefal ist ac ut do mane rem ar di un pu vel met od fe hom est cum orme th ingus nu ul om oblit od hi tr ob to ho ou nd ve sc cre so ig h fu of fr hu gr um em  mens do cl vo tem cri we tu ig cr: hoto hi wo menstare nonst pareg ot ing ig fahe cilv si mot fo mu fr.

12. And it cepit Sara between se in porta the tabernacula risum vidisse tam solum Sara veneranda confirmando lau da lo cur mi hic chnir hic por ul ed sis tiom gra que ib ig is ri ta b cor id dic cl ac pl nu fer for we fi qua va fanta scil com lo lu ign ce ag ob w tic hic os ir pl va ing wo com pro cur sen vo ist ign mot ap ba fac sp op om fac ni go niis oc ge on we ci pi es um dama ib cre cur pori ra gra tr of oc b fr tem tra sim cr pro da fer lina on el for sap h as sc ign un pl w hu ad ti gra om ist em at ter od the mu c u oc lo pl liam vi ut cor pr ou lo tra ac ou us cor ab i fu h rhiom con op et fu cil ou oust id ve al wi, na wo men u.
